titles.title: Register America to Vote Act
Register America to Vote Act
A bill to require States to automatically register eligible voters at the time they turn 18 to vote in Federal elections, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

bill.summary:
Register America to Vote Act
This bill directs each state that has a voter registration requirement for federal elections to automatically register eligible individuals when they turn 18 years old. States that do not implement automatic registration must permit eligible individuals to register and vote on the day of a federal election.
The Election Assistance Commission shall make grants to states to implement automatic voter registration and improve election security systems related to voter registration.
The bill revises the procedure for voting following a registered voter's failure to return a change of address card.
